page.title: 02BUILDINGS
page.content: {..Main Buildings In Our Area.. {Holy Trinity Church,Norton Lindsey. 11th.century Saxon font is the oldest part of the Church. Tenor bell c.1350 Treble bell c.1875. Churchyard Cross 1892 is on the old base of an original Saxon cross. Restored 1874 remains now. {St. Mary the Virgin,Wolverton. Said to date from 1208. Chancel added, consecrated 1316.Tin roof 1st.of kind, made in B'ham.Two bells,one early,one dated 1771.14th.cent.glass,bad order. {Wolverton Junior & Infant School. Opened 6th. Nov.1876.78 children in 1 classroom!1926 seniors transferred so became J.& I.only.The school is now under the threat of closure & everyone is fighting hard to save it.We have 27 children on the roll in July 1986. The Windmill.It has not been used since 1906 but provides an interesting landmark.It is used as a residence now
